title.narrative: IR 5.2: CHILD POVERTY AND WELL-BEING

description.narrative: Updated research evidence on child poverty and well-being, focusing on disparities, is available to influence child-friendly social and budget policies and inform programmes, which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Evaluation And Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Social policies, programmes, public opinion and social norms are strengthened to promote and advance child rights

mailing-address.narrative: 87 Misr Helwan Agricultural Road Maadi Cairo

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Updated research evidence on child poverty and well-being, focusing on disparities, is available to influence child-friendlysocial and budget policies and inform programmes

description.narrative: New evidence on child poverty and on existing disparities in the country is available to inform policy dialogue. Functioning of the national cash transfer programme strengthened through an improved Monitoring and Evaluation system and increased availability of information on service readiness linked to the programme conditionalities | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2018
